10.text:
(Lord’s day). Up, and at my chamber
all the morning and the office

14.text:
doing business, and also reading
a little of “L’escholle des filles,”

19.text:
which is a mighty lewd book,
but yet not amiss for a sober man

22.text:
once to read over to inform himself
in the villainy of the world.

27.text:
At noon home to dinner, where by appointment
Mr. Pelling came and with him three friends,

33.text:
Wallington, that sings the good base,
and one Rogers, and a gentleman...

38.text:
[VO] Pepys came from a relatively simple
background (his father was a tailor)

43.text:
and he rose through his own abilities to
become an administrator of the English navy.

48.text:
He personally witnessed some of
the major events of his time:

51.text:
he was on the boat when Charles II
returned from exile to be crowned.

56.text:
He was in London during the Plague
and the Great Fire of London.

60.text:
He thought his eyesight was failing and in 1669,
with some regret, stopped writing his diary.

66.text:
In the event, his sight was not impaired.
Nevertheless it remains a remarkable document,

72.text:
and one of the most vivid and personal
portraits of the 17th century we have.

77.text:
[VO] After dinner we into our dining-room,
and there to singing all the afternoon.

82.text:
(By the way, I must remember that Pegg Pen
was brought to bed yesterday of a girl;

87.text:
and, among other things,
if I have not already set it down,

91.text:
that hardly ever was remembered such a season for
the smallpox as these last two months have been,

97.text:
people being seen all up and down the streets,
newly come out after the smallpox.)

104.text:
[VO] Samuel Pepys himself led such a rich life –
he was an extremely capable man,

110.text:
a member of the Royal Society and therefore very
much in the forefront of the new science of the day;

115.text:
yet he also loved the theatre,
loved playing his musical instruments;

120.text:
and to the end of the diary,
remained a man of lively curiosity

123.text:
and energy which remains apparent
in all aspects of his life.
